subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The Dodgers’ Takashi Saito will miss at least six weeks with an elbow injury, and more if surgery is required. That opens the door for Jonathan Broxton, below, to take over as the closer. He has flourished as a setup man for two and a half seasons, but while he is still striking out more than one batter an inning (48 in 40 2/3) with a 3.32 earned run average this season, he has not been as dominant as he was in 2006 and 2007, when he struck out 196 in 158 1/3 with a 2.73 E.R.A.
